skillTree.localised_description: It is said that a town ruled by Gashnag was being harassed by a group of Ogres. The Black Prince set out on his own, beneath his black cloak, and came back with the pillagers' heads, to be put on pikes.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Wrath of the Strigoi Prince"

skillTree.localised_description: Gashnag allows a few well-controlled ghouls and beasts to circle around his forces, attacking his foes and his foes only. Even if the wretched creatures are incredibly well-behaved for their type and ultimately fight on the humans' side, old habits die hard and many start connecting the dots.

enabled_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ogres, Greenskins, Chaos Worshippers, all shall be punished for the destruction they perpetrate against Gashnagia.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +10 against Chaos, Norsca, Greenskins and Ogre Kingdoms
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 when in own territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The fall of Ushoran's empire burns vivid in Gashnag's cultivated memories. The other bloodlines are not to be trusted, not even fellow Strigoi.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 against Vampire Counts and Vampire Coast
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Causes Fear against Vampire Counts and Vampire Coast
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Led from the front by their powerful and selfless Prince, the citizens of Gashnagia fight like one.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Promoting conservative tactics, Gashnag preserves his subject's safety until melee is inevitable.
Seeding constant confusion among the opponents, the Black Prince protects his subjects from harm.

effects.description:
Attribute: Cause Fear for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
"See my coat of crimson armour? It is strengthened by thine blood and fear."
"Look into mine eyes, mortal; what glories do you see?"
The sword-strikes of mortal man are but clumsy, childish lunges before the preternatural speed of a Vampire.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Strike hard, strike true.
The strength of this Vampire to endure the centuries is beyond compare.
To look upon this Undead Lord is to witness true and absolute horror!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Well, this is straightforward enough.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Oh wait, there's another chapter.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the lousiest commander knows that you need two halves of a pair of scissors.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +3 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Duck! Shoot! Duck! Shoot! Shoot- shoot, that was wrong.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +3% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +6% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +3% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +3 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "You kill them before they kill you, sonnie. That's all it is."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Though of course, if they do stab you, you better know how to parry."

effects.description:
Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Plus, you better kill them dead with the one shot you have."

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "And to do that, it helps if you put all your weight where it counts."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +2% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Look, at the end of the day, you may be alive and you better learn from what didn't kill you."

effects.description:
Physical resistance: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Know thy enemy, and fight it with its own tools.

effects.description:
Attrition: +15% enemy casualties from untainted territory
	(enemy armies in local province)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: +25% enemy casualties from untainted territory
	(enemy armies in local province)

Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Everything stands on Gashnag not being recognized for what he is. As such, mages and agents have to be kept at a safe distance.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +15% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: Even in his delusions, Gashnag knows that he doesn't need to conquer more lands to keep his own happy. Even if the neighbours don't know what they're talking to.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +5 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms
Diplomatic relations: +10 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms

skillTree.localised_description: Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: Divine worship aside, Ushoran's empire was still fundamentally happy and loyal, which is fairly uncommon on its own right.
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

factionEffects.localised_description: Gashnag's benevolent rule encourages a stable kingdom, but his own nature is a tricky matter.

effects.description: Hardened Veterans: Strong Vigour, +5 Armour, +8%% Damage for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Recruitment and Upkeep cost: +50% for Knights of the Righteous Spear and Sisters of Fury
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
Melee defence: +4 when in own territory

items.colour_text: Learning from the Strigoi patriarch's secrets and mistakes could be priceless.

effects.description:
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from wasteland attrition
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: One of Ushoran's own artefacts, this polestaff supposedly allowed the original Strigoi patriarch to hold off the Lahmians' aggression for so long.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Very personal aggressors find out too late that it is not easy to stab a powerful Strigoi cloaked in illusions.
